meanings.definition: A quantity or number of things or persons dealt with as a group
meanings.sent1: The baker made a large batched of cookies for the school event.
meanings.sent2: The farmer harvested a batched of ripe apples from the orchard.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to form a batched to work on the project together.
meanings.sent4: The team of firefighters worked together as a well-organized batched to put out the fire.
meanings.sent5: The factory produced a batched of new toys to be shipped to stores.

meanings.definition: To group together or process as a batch
meanings.sent1: The chef batched the ingredients together to make a delicious soup.
meanings.sent2: The company batched the orders to streamline the shipping process.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to batched their study sessions for better time management.
meanings.sent4: The computer program batched the data for faster processing speed.
meanings.sent5: The librarian batched the returned books to be reshelved efficiently.
